oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John Stow, The Annales, or Generall Chronicle
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
Theater--England--London--History--17th century--London, England
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Stow (1524 or 1525â€“1605) was a prolific historian whose oft-published Annales (of England) and Survay (of London) survived his own death under the hands of later editors. In this excerpt, he refers to the masque (The Masque of Flowers) performed by the gentlemen of Gray's Inn for the wedding of Robert Ker and Frances Howard on 23 December, 1613.
